metadata.title: CVE-2015-3815 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The detect_version function in wiretap/logcat.c in the Android Logcat fileparser in Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.5 does not check the length of thepayload, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a packet with a craftedpayload, as demonstrated by a length of zero, a different vulnerabilitythan CVE-2015-3906.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3815` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark3 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap3 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil3 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
